place.name: SPRIDLINGTON
place.gazetteerText: SPRIDLINGTON, a parish in the district and county of Lincoln; 5 miles W by N of Wickenby r. station, and 9 NNE of Lincoln. It has a post-office under Market-Rasen. Acres, 2,180. Real property, £2,918. Pop., 311. Houses, 58. The property is divided between two. The living is a rectory in the diocese of Lincoln. Value, £454.* Patron, the Rev. H. F. Hutton. The church is good; and there are a Wesleyan chapel, a free school, and charities £5. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
